Cindy Campbell.Action: Shares her insecurities about being new and feeling like a geek, showing vulnerability.
Willingly participates in Shorty's efforts to help her fit in by learning rhythm and slang.
Suddenly punches a passing female student without apparent provocation.
Feels intimidated by college and unsure of herself, admits to feeling like a geek.
Clumsily mimics rhythm and slang as taught by Shorty but struggles initially.
Successfully executes a rhythmic and slang combination after practice, showing ability to learn new things.
Unexpectedly punches a passing female student aggressively.
Slaps Shorty a high-five and gives Shorty a hug before they part ways.
Delivers a crossover kick and successfully overpowers the student, forcing them to give up a leather jacket.
Poses in a gangster lean and asks if she looks cool, showing social awareness but also seeking validation.
Approaches a young upset girl and asks if she is okay, listening to her story with empathy.
Approaches and talks calmly and empathetically to a distressed girl, showing social awareness and initiative.
Passes several activity booths without engaging or showing leadership in any.
Greets Brenda politely and participates in introductions despite the awkward situation.
Does not confront Alex about his rude interruption and strange behavior toward Brenda.
Mentions she hasn’t dated in a while honestly when asked about boyfriend status.
Engages in polite social introduction and acknowledges Brenda properly.
Passively follows Alex's lead without adding much to the conversation or situation.
Does not interrupt or correct misinformation about her, showing restraint and social tact.
Responds positively and politely to Brenda's conversation and compliments.
Correctly identifies next class and room number when asked.
Passively lets Brenda guide behavior based on superstition without question.
Ray bends down to help her with her fallen books after their collision.
Tells Ray to stay away from her despite his attempt to reconcile.
Politely accepts help from Ray after accidentally colliding with him and dropping her books.
Recognizes Ray and immediately sets a clear boundary by telling him to stay away from her.
Storms into class after confrontation without attempting to de-escalate or clarify any misunderstanding.
Offers to help Dwight pass back papers despite his initial rejection.
Politely thanks Buddy when he returns her book.
Politely rejects Buddy's romantic advance and offers friendship instead.
Smiles despite Buddy playing a prank on her (wedgy).
Makes herself at home in a strange house, takes food and money without asking.
Attempts to communicate politely by repeatedly saying 'Hello?' and trying to find someone.
Slams strange door knocker repeatedly and pushes against the door until it opens.
Walks through the house making herself at home, exploring, interacting with objects, and attempting to communicate.
Pockets some change from cushions without hesitation.
Deliberately knocks over a domino in a carefully planned layout, implying awareness and a playful, controlled approach.
Reads pieces of mail and seems to try to grasp the situation by acting out "your test results are in".
Is startled by Hanson’s sudden appearance and reacts with a fake strained smile, showing some social skill but also vulnerability.
Reluctantly shakes Hanson's hand when introduced.
Greets everyone excitedly upon entering the dining room.
Smiles and greets Buddy before he punches her in the chest and mocks her size.
Does not react angrily or aggressively to Buddy's chest punch and teasing, instead staggers to her feet quietly.
Sits down quietly after being pulled out from under an unknowingly removed chair, accepting the situation without complaint.
Sits down amidst group, attempts casual interaction despite being ignored.
Falls after Buddy punches her unexpectedly; staggers to her feet.
Asks Professor a relevant question about the house's history, showing awareness of situation.
Breaks the tension by reaching for a roll and commenting positively on the food's warmth and softness.
Takes a big bite of the roll but spits out a mouthful into her napkin after learning the rolls were made by hand (implying likely that it's uncomfortable or unpleasant).
Breaks tension by attempting humor about the buns and takes a big bite of the roll.
Eats the roll and compliments its smell before spitting it out after realizing it's made with creepy fingers.
Smiles appreciatively when Hanson places the pie on her plate, showing friendliness and good-natured acceptance.
Allows Buddy to stick his finger in her pie without protest, tolerating the prank in good humor.
Smiles and is about to eat dessert calmly after others have been teasing.
Asks the Professor a genuine question about the history of the house, showing interest in the group's story.
Asks the professor about the history of the house, seeking relevant information.
Expresses concern for Brenda's well-being after she is hurt by the piano wire.
Notices the dead bird and gently removes it from the cage, expressing sympathy.
Eats the fried bird with Shorty after tossing its bones in a cigar box.
Notices a dead bird and gently removes it from the cage, showing awareness and care.
Flushes the dead bird down the toilet initially, indicating lack of a better solution.
Eats the fried dead bird along with Shorty, following an unusual idea without questioning its wisdom.
Shares food with Shorty and compliments his idea.
Takes initiative to alert others about the strange situation in the kitchen.
Engages others (Professor and Dwight) to witness and investigate the phenomenon, showing enthusiasm and teamwork.
Notices the strange state of the kitchen, asks Shorty about it, and promptly calls for help from Dwight and the Professor.
Draws a circle and arrows on the floor to conduct an experiment, uses a camera to record the phenomenon.
Shows excitement and confidence when the chair moves, indicating belief in her procedures.
No actions or statements in this excerpt; mostly focusing on Theo's behavior.
Engages Buddy in a sincere conversation about friendship, expressing a desire for gentle, meaningful interaction.
Responds to Buddy's rough behavior assertively but without anger, setting boundaries calmly.
Questions the mysterious voice and tries to get information by asking how she can help and where to go.
Gets hit unexpectedly by a football thrown by Buddy and staggers, showing a moment of physical vulnerability.
Responds to Buddy's rough behavior calmly and attempts to set boundaries and steer the friendship towards more thoughtful communication.
Notices bloodied footprints and takes the lead in investigating the secret passage and room.
Calmly points out important information about the house's history to Buddy.
Responds positively to Buddy's comparison of the painting to her, calling the woman beautiful and showing modesty.
Feels bad after Buddy's harsh and insensitive personal insults.
Notices bloodied footprints on the floor and follows them, discovering a secret passage and secret room.
Reads an old newspaper headline and article, connecting it to the house's mysterious history beyond what was initially told.
Shows sensitivity to criticism from Buddy and is affected emotionally.
Annoyed but engages with Buddy, shows curiosity by finding Carolyn's chest and sharing with Buddy.
Finds a decorated chest with a name on it and recognizes it likely belonged to a person of interest, indicating observational skill and connection-making.
Gets startled by a black cat and reacts with fear or surprise, showing a momentary lack of composure.
Sighs relief and attempts to calm the cat by friendly greeting 'Hey, kitty, kitty. How you doin' girl?'
Responds aggressively and violently to the cat's attack, escalating the confrontation.
Catches and throws the aggressive cat, engages in close combat, flips the cat over and pushes a broken bottle at its throat.
Allows the cat to repeatedly attack, gets pinned to the floor, has sand thrown in her eyes and suffers a chair broken over her head, showing difficulty controlling the situation.
Desperately calls for help when trapped by the cat.
Tries to distract the aggressive cat with a ball of yarn to save herself.
Escapes from danger while injured and allows Theo to help her.
Says good-night to Theo and thanks him for his offer of help, showing polite appreciation.
Insists that something strange is happening in the house, expressing sincerity and concern.
Carefully retrieves and investigates the fallen picture and discovers a hidden key, showing curiosity but no clear warmth indicator.
Explores contents of the chest including personal items of Carolyn, and places the pendant around her neck, displaying engagement and possibly empathy or connection.
Approaches Professor wearing a striking outfit and engages with a playful attitude, referencing 'forbidden fruit', mixing flirtation and possibly manipulation.
Notices the picture falling, discovers hidden key, uses it to open a chest and explore its contents, including a diary and pendant.
Confidently interacts with the Professor, using the pendant to change her demeanor to a seductive and controlled one.
Expresses that something strange is happening and insists she is not crazy, showing awareness and intuition.
Leaves the room alone despite sensing something 'going on' in the house, potentially exposing herself to danger.
Chokes on a banana and the Professor helps her with the Heimlich maneuver.
Uses provocative and sexually suggestive actions to seduce the Professor.
Takes initiative to confront the Professor aggressively, explores suspicious clues like dentures and adult diaper, and creates confusion to manipulate the situation.
Misjudges the situation leading to a misunderstanding and passes out after an emotional outburst.
Reading Carolyn's journal and recognizing its disturbing content, showing awareness and concern.
Yells sincerely for help while clinging to bed during a terrifying event.
Attempts to escape rising bath water by trying multiple methods to unplug drain and sends a note for help despite being trapped and barely able to move.
Sends a help note while drowning, leading others to rush to her aid.
Shares important information about the secret room and news clippings, showing concern for group's safety.
Passes the picture of the wife to Theo, promotes group awareness.
Snatches the picture back after receiving multiple sarcastic and insulting comments about her appearance and family.
Responds matter-of-factly to Theo's question about the woman in the picture, revealing a tragic family detail without dramatizing.
Snatches the picture back when others mock her, showing assertiveness and setting boundaries.
Responds to Alex's remarks about the Professor's wife and expressing belief 'I think he wants me.'
Does not respond directly to Buddy’s warning about danger or offer solutions, remaining passive in a tense moment.
Suggests taking her car to leave.
Expresses fear for the group's safety, showing concern for others.
Asks aloud what they are going to do, indicating involvement and a desire to cooperate.
Recognizes the danger and verbalizes the threat clearly: 'He won't let us go. He's going to kill us.'
Passively asks 'What are we gonna do?' after the group is already attempting to act without offering solutions or taking initiative.
Watches as Dwight distributes equipment and explains their use without intervening or questioning the efficacy of his plans.
Does not show initiative or leadership in handling the ghost-hunting equipment or strategy in this excerpt.
Tries to stop Alex from running off to face danger alone, expresses concern that Alex will be killed.
Ignores advice to let Alex go and worries about her safety despite opposition.
Tries to stop Alex from running off alone, shows concern for her safety.
Argues against splitting up but is overruled and passively goes along with the plan.
Accepts Theo's cynical reasoning about letting Alex go without pushing further.
No direct action or dialogue by Cindy in the excerpt; interaction focuses on Alex and Theo, showing no supportive intervention or friendliness from Cindy.
Trips over the carpet, is repeatedly attacked and pinned down, suggests a lack of physical coordination and situational control.
Insists on checking the furnace despite wanting to leave quickly.
Works cooperatively with Buddy to investigate and confront danger.
Screams for help while running from danger, showing vulnerability and trust in others for assistance.
Splits up from companion to evade threat, prioritizing survival but potentially risking group safety.
Smiles, realizing the skeleton poses no threat; participates in playful behavior with Brenda by playing Keep-Away with the skull.
Trips the skeleton to make it fall, contributing to its humiliation while it hops away.
Expresses concern for Buddy when he is lifted off the ground by a ghost and calls for Brenda to help.
Catches the skeleton's skull, trips the body to stop it.
Watches Brenda run after ghost without intervening, appears confused and less proactive.
Rushes to help Buddy after he falls and injures himself, helps him to first aid.
Successfully shoots at the ghost, hitting it and forcing it to flee.
Quickly assesses Buddy's injury and takes initiative to lead him to the first aid kit.
Quickly thinks to use blood bags from the freezer to potentially create a distraction or trap upon hearing a noise.
Carefully watches the blood on the floor for footprints after spilling it, indicating situational awareness and cautious observation.
Answers a suspicious phone call and tries to mislead the caller with a fake accent to hide her identity.
Is visibly shocked after accidentally spilling the blood intended for a hospital patient, showing a moment of emotional distraction.
Engages in a somewhat silly and unfocused conversation with Buddy about fantasies and moon-walking, showing lack of seriousness in a tense situation.
Rushes to help Buddy after both are attacked by the ghost.
Tries to call for help despite difficult circumstances.
Raises her gun quickly in self-defense after being slapped by the ghost.
Attempts to use a communication device for help despite signal issues.
Gets knocked down hard into the freezer and is briefly dazed.
Rushes to help Buddy after he is attacked, showing quick response and concern.
Unable to prevent the door from locking and the freezer becoming a dangerous trap.
Rubs Buddy's legs and thighs to try to warm him up, attempts to help in a difficult situation.
Engages in a distracting or inappropriate method to warm Buddy, seemingly influenced by Buddy's manipulations.
Frantically builds a cat bulldozer from scraps to save Buddy and helps him out of the freezer.
Tells Buddy to stay put while she goes to warn the others, showing responsibility and concern for group safety.
Attempts to communicate urgently with others to coordinate help and warn them about the ghost.
Upon seeing Shorty tied up and Hanson behaving suspiciously, she hides a snow globe behind her back, possibly indicating caution or distrust.
Builds a makeshift bulldozer from loose nuts, bolts, wire, and a defibrillator MacGyver-style to help Buddy escape.
Uses a radio device effectively to communicate with Ray and provide important information about their situation.
Recognizes danger quickly and takes initiative to warn others by leaving Buddy to fend for himself temporarily.
Approaches a potentially dangerous situation in the kitchen cautiously, hiding the snow globe behind her back indicating strategic thinking.
Manages a smile and complies with Hanson’s requests despite alarm, showing willingness to engage peacefully.
Pulls out multiple weapons and places them on the table, preparing for danger rather than trust.
Whispers concern to Shorty and questions Hanson about drugging him, showing care and protectiveness.
Responds to Shorty’s delirious statement with a somewhat sarcastic and guarded comment, indicating distance or hesitation.
Looks on in horror but does not intervene while Hanson performs a disturbing act on Shorty's brain.
Asks Hanson to stop the harm to Shorty's brain, indicating some awareness and care.
Tells Hanson to stop touching Shorty's brain.
Grabs the snowglobe to hit Hanson when he is being reckless.
Physical confrontation with Hanson—getting slammed, hair locked in door.
Tells Hanson to stop touching Shorty's brain, showing awareness of the situation and trying to intervene.
Attempts to strike Hanson with the snowglobe but is stopped and physically overpowered, leading to a compromised situation.
Handcuffs Hanson's hand to hers to restrain him and prevent harm.
Warns Brenda and Theo about Hanson's evil intent and urges to stop him.
Runs after Hanson to stop his evil actions despite personal risk.
Works together with Brenda and Theo to overcome obstacles, helping each other over a gate and confronting Hanson as a team.
Engages in a physical fight with Hanson to protect or defend, showing bravery and solidarity.
Drops from the chain and continues to fight even though injured, demonstrating resilience and commitment to the group.
Leaps over a fence, swings on a chain, and kicks an opponent in the chest, showing physical agility and combativeness.
Attempts a running leap kick on Hanson but fails to anticipate his bat attack and gets hit in the head, losing the fight.
Engages in playful and humorous kung fu fighting moves, entertaining others and lightening the mood.

Displays various Kung Fu fight techniques creatively (Crane style, Crouching Tiger style, Drunk Monkey, Mad Cow, Horny Dog, Camel Toe), uses humor and distraction effectively, and successfully causes Hanson's short circuit and eventual combustion.
Volunteers to lure the ghost onto the platform despite the danger.
Asserts ownership over the situation, refusing Buddy’s interference.
Volunteers to lure the ghost onto the platform despite the evident danger, showing initiative and confidence.
Yells defiantly at the ghost to come and get her, demonstrating courage and an understanding of the situation’s demands.
Stays on the platform even when warned her life is at risk, which could show either steadfastness or a failure to strategize escape efficiently.
Expresses concern for Ray after he saves her life.
Speaks gently and soothingly to the ghost, encouraging him to find peace.
Says a sincere goodbye to the ghost, acknowledging his feelings.
Calmly soothes the ghost, persuades him to let go and accept peace, showing emotional intelligence and presence of mind during a stressful supernatural event.
Allows herself to be tackled and thrown to the ground rather than moving away or preparing for safety, showing a lack of physical assertiveness or self-protection.
Hugs Shorty warmly upon seeing he is alive and expresses concern about his head injury.
Encourages the group to leave together after their ordeal.
Runs up to Father McFeely to share their survival and story.
Encourages the group to leave quickly with confidence after the ordeal.
Runs up to Father McFeely and engages him immediately to explain the situation.
Appears confused and bewildered along with the others when the authorities ignore them, indicating a lack of control over the situation.
Insists her friends are alive and present when McFeely ignores them.
Asks McFeely to explain what happened, showing concern and desire for understanding.
Expresses distress loudly ('Noooooooo!') when witnessing tragic events.
Speaks positively about her situation and expresses gratitude for survival and her relationships.
Talks affectionately to her pet bird, showing friendliness and caring.
Insists that her friends are alive despite evidence to the contrary, showing emotional denial rather than clear understanding.
Asks Father McFeely to explain what happened, displaying some attempt to seek information.
Expresses distress ('Noooooooo!') when friends are incapacitated, indicating emotional but not effective problem-solving response.
Is hit and seemingly killed by a vehicle, reflecting vulnerability and lack of situational awareness.
After returning to school, talks casually and optimistically about situation, showing some resilience and social engagement.
Loads a care package with dangerous items (a shank, a zip gun, a file, cigarettes) and a prank item (Ass-troglide) to send to someone
Smiles when receiving flowers from Buddy but punches him in the chest and mocks him
Asks her father for money and appears to be deceitful about the counterfeit cash
Recognizes counterfeit money and prepares a care package with practical and threatening items (shank, zip gun, file).
Requests more money from her dad after college refuses her fake tuition payment, showing awareness of the problem.
Punches Buddy quickly and confidently as he arrives with flowers.
Jokes sarcastically about the flowers and punches Buddy, indicating confident and assertive behavior.
Swipes her finger under Buddy's nose and runs off, playfully teasing him.
Repeatedly interrupts Buddy while he is trying to express his feelings, mocking him by mimicking his words.
Swipes finger under Buddy's nose playfully, interrupts him repeatedly, and mocks his attempts to talk seriously.
Charmed and appreciative when Buddy protects her from a bee.
Shares money willingly to buy food together.
Mocks Buddy by calling romantic ideas 'kinda gay' but accepts them because Buddy is a guy.
Expresses fear and confusion when confronted by Hanson.
Pulls cash out of her pocket to pay for soda and chooses hot dogs, showing a small degree of decisiveness in a casual setting.
Expresses confusion and panic upon seeing Hanson, fails to respond or take protective action when threatened.
Depends on Buddy for protection and is passive when Buddy runs away, showing reliance on others rather than taking initiative.
Is nearly attacked but is saved at the last moment by an external force, does not take direct action to avoid the threat.
